pullRequest.title: [neohub] new/legacy API; null annotations; enhancements; bugs; logging
pullRequest.bodyText:
NEW support for new API calls: Heatmiser has deprecated some legacy API calls, and introduced new calls to replace them. So this release adds support for the new API. There is automatic switchover from the legacy API to the new (whenever the new API is detected). And for backwards compatibility there is a new configuration parameter for the hub Thing in OpenHAB that allows one to force using the old API, so long as it is still present.
NEW JUnit test suite added for both the legacy and the new APIs.
ENHANCED support for Units of Measure both for reading from the hub, and now (new) writing to the hub.
ENHANCED support for various types of Heatmiser devices.
BUG FIX the Heatmiser Boost repeaters are no longer treated as thermostats; so they are now excluded from the device discovery process.
BUG FIX the Channel type for door and window contacts has been corrected from On/Off to Contact type.
ENHANCED improvements in the clarity of logging messages.
ENHANCED a new hub configuration parameter has been added for the TCP socket time out; allows the time out to be extended in case of communication issues.
ENHANCED the configuration parameters for socket time out, polling interval, and TCP port have been moved to advanced level so as not to confuse regular users.
ENHANCED Heatmiser devices often suffer RF radio mesh dropouts, but the hub / binding would continue to send the last known state of Channels. Now if there is a dropout, the binding sends an UNDEF Channel state. However for backwards compatibility, a new Channel configuration parameter has been added to hold the last known state.
BUG FIX all classes are now declared @NonNullByDefault and the code has been refactored throughout to eliminate all null related compiler warnings.
BUG FIX the socket reader fetches JSON strings with a \0 terminator, but sometimes the hub doesn’t send a \0 so the fetch timed out; it now also accepts \n as a valid terminator.

Signed-off-by: Andrew Fiddian-Green software@whitebear.ch

commit.message:
[neohub] new/legacy API; null annotations; enhancements; bugs; logging

Signed-off-by: Andrew Fiddian-Green <software@whitebear.ch>

nodes.bodyText:
Rather than a "main" unit test method I would prefer if each of these methods were their own unit test.
I guess this would be ok if each of these tests rely on the state left by a prior state. If that is not the case please add a @Test annotation to each of these test methods.
Why is this warning suppressed here?

commit.message:
[neohub] adopted suggestions from code review by @cpmeister

Signed-off-by: Andrew Fiddian-Green <software@whitebear.ch>

nodes.bodyText: If the api is offline shouldn't that cause the thing to go offline as well?
should probably still log this as debug or trace.
same here

commit.message:
[neohub] adopted suggestions mad in code review by @cpmeister

Signed-off-by: Andrew Fiddian-Green <software@whitebear.ch>

nodes.bodyText: It seems like you are trying to implement an expiring cache, so why not try using openhab's ExpiringCache class?

I've spent a lot of time trying to figure out how all this expiration stuff works and frankly I think it is too complicated for a variety of reasons. One of the reasons is that you are modifying handler state in your getter methods. I don't think this logic belongs here and instead should be moved to the caller of this method.
I don't know why you are checking systemDataDirty here. It would be better to push the burden of checking systemDataDirty on the caller.
Wouldn't this log every hour then regardless of if the unit changed or not? If you going to log it that frequently I'd prefer if you changed this to debug.
